external.en_us:
Tourpusher provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for own personal safety and the safety of co-workers
  • Relieve day Toolpusher
  • Assist OIM in all operations carried out on the rig
  • Provide Drillers and crewmembers help and guidance as needed
  • Ensure activities are conducted in compliance with permits and drilling program
  • Assist Drillers in delegating work for crewmembers and follow through
  • Ensure rig and equipment is maintained properly
  • Assist Operator Representative in any matter they have concerning the rig or well
  • Maintain good working relations with other departments
  • Participate in on-the-job training and formal training of crews
  • Assist in making sure all paperwork is done correctly and in a timely fashion
  • Keep a good attitude about job and surroundings

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 5 years as toolpusher in the industry industry.
  • Must possess current well control certification, 1st Aid, CPR and Forklift/Manlift certificates.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to use simple math to make job related calculations.
  • Knowledge of top drive design and function.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb derrick structures with required PPE, climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness for lengthy periods of time and lift 50 lbs.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.
  • Must be able to work night shifts.

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

external.en_us: The incumbent is responsible for developing and designing learning and development systems and processes.

Chugach Alaska Services, LLC (CAS) is an Alaska Native-owned and operated staffing firm supporting Alaska's Oil & Gas Industry for over 28 years. CAS is recruiting for a Learning Content Developer located in Anchorage, AK.

 

DEPARTMENT: Chugach Alaska Services, LLC                                    REPORTS TO: Staffing Program Manager

LOCATION: Anchorage, Alaska                                                               FLSA STATUS: Non-Exempt, FT

EEOC Job Category: Professional

Expected Behaviors:

Chugach strives to employ individuals who believe the following behaviors are fundamental to any job: 

  1. Always do the right thing 
  2. Create meaningful value 
  3. Leave things better than you found them 
  4. Empower people 
  5. Build community

Position Summary:

The incumbent is responsible for developing and designing learning and development systems and processes.

Essential Duties & Job Functions:

  • Develop training content (Storyline, Articulate, Adobe, PPT, etc)
  • Ensure online course shells and materials are aesthetically pleasing, functional and engaging for the students.
  • Create and update training templates (PowerPoint, Articulate Rise, Storyline)
  • Experience filming and editing videos is preferred
  • Create infographics and other visual resources to assist in adult learning. Experience with Adobe products is preferred
  • Work with Subject Matter experts to ensure the accuracy of the content developed prior to being delivered
  • Design, create, revise and structure content, activities, and materials for an online and blended format with a focus on the learner’s experience
  • Work with Subject Matter Experts to identify learning needs
  • Create media to support learning (e.g., visual aids for face-to-face, various multimedia for e-learning and online)
  • Familiarity with LMS, CMS, and E-Learning standards (AICC, SCORM, xAPI, etc.) preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Flexible in changing environments
  • Strong interpersonal skills and evidence of effective relationship management. Apply effective and timely project management skills to handle multiple concurrent projects.
  • Execute project requirements working under tight deadlines. Maintain excellent interpersonal relationships with employees and vendors.

Other Job Responsibilities:

  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements (Education, Experience, Training & Professional Certificates/Associations):

Mandatory

  • High proficiency with general technology tools (MS Suite, SharePoint, computer navigation)
  • Associates degree in Education, Infographics or similar.
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills.
  • Effective communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision.
  • Successfully pass a pre-employment background check, medical and drug screening.

Preferred

  • Bachelor’s degree in Education, Infographics or similar.

Physical Demand/Work Environment:

 The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by the incumbent to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to type, talk and hear. The incumbent is frequently required to sit, stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel or crouch. The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Visual acuity: must be adequate to perform all required tasks in a safe manner.

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate but may be loud on occasion. Work is usually performed in an office setting and sometimes at a client facility or job site. Work may require occasional weekend and/or evening work. The incumbent is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts, vehicles, and equipment.

 The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by the incumbent to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to type, talk and hear.  Visual acuity: must be adequate to perform all required tasks in a safe manner.

Disclaimer: The above job description covers the principal duties and responsibilities of the job. The description shall not, however, be construed as a complete job listing of all duties, which may be required from day-to-day.

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

name.en_us: Associates of Applied Science Process Technology

educations.description: The process technology program prepares students for employment as operations technicians in the process industry. This includes oil and gas production, mining and milling, transportation and refining, chemical manufacturing, power generation, utilities, wastewater treatment facilities maintenance and food processing.

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

The information that is provided in this application for employment is true, correct and complete. If employed, any misstatement or omission of fact on this application may result in my dismissal. external.en_us:
Pit Watcher provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Pitwatcher performs drilling fluid mixing operations, drilling fluid property sampling, monitoring of well bore returns, maintenance of mud pumps and drilling fluid circulations system.
  • Record drilling fluid properties and chemicals used
  • Maintain spare parts lists for solid control and circulation equipment
  • Record maintenance performed on solids control and circulation equipment
  • Maintain drilling fluid solids control and circulation equipment
  • Carry out routine drilling property sampling
  • Mixing of drilling fluid chemicals and maintenance of drilling fluid properties
  • Cleaning and maintenance of pits
  • Maintain clear communication with relief, mud engineers, derrickhand and driller

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 3 years in the drilling industry as a Floorman or above.
  • Must possess current well control certification, 1st Aid, CPR and Forklift/Manlift certificates.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to use simple math to make job related calculations.
  • Knowledge of top drive design and function.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb derrick structures with required PPE, climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness for lengthy periods of time and lift 50 lbs.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale

Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

work_experience.description: • Provide strategic HR leadership and consultation to officers and line managers. • Oversee recruitment and retention program for the Salvation Army. • Manage employee benefits and retirement programs. • Supervise HR department staff. • Manage performance evaluation process. • Develop and update personnel policies.

• Conducted and managed investigations regarding employee complaints, grievances, and other employee relations matters. • Consulted with legal counsel on personnel related matters when appropriate. • Advised management regarding employee relations matters dealing with corrective action, discipline, leave of absence and safety. • Served as Acting HR Director in the absence of the HR Director, to include supervision of HR staff. • Drafted personnel policies and other HR procedures. • Prepared and writes reports utilizing Business Intelligence in Ulti Pro for a variety of purposes according to business needs. • Oversaw exit interviews and termination notifications, and assisted managers with questions on terminating employees. • Assisted in workforce reduction planning. Communicated to employees regarding layoffs. • Facilitated return-to-work process and answers employee's questions on return-to-work. • Performed full-cycle recruitment for senior level positions.

• Developed and implemented specialized multidisciplinary recruiting, advertising and marketing strategies for sourcing and referring qualified applicants for all vacancies. • Reviewed and analyzed requests for recruitment assistance; identified needs of the facility regarding the vacancy and requirements of the position. Identified and utilized advertising sources. • Contacted and screened applicants; provided vacancy and organizational information to applicants. Documented applicants in recruitment database system; referred qualified applicants to hiring managers. Guided potential applicants through the recruitment and referral process. • Marketed and promoted ANTHC and its regional sites at job fairs and national conferences. Networked, collaborated and promoted organization with other institutions, universities, and professional organizations. • Reviewed and tracked vacancies. Identified and tracked recruitment strategies, successes, initiatives and trends.

• Managed the hiring process for exempt and non-exempt employees throughout the state of Alaska. • Selected, trained, and supervised In-Store Recruiters at each store location. • Interviewed and selected new hires for retail store positions. • Developed and coordinated hiring action plans for remodels and new store openings. • Established and maintained relationships with employment referral sources. • Represented Carrs/Safeway at job fairs and community events. • Partnered with community based organizations to increase applicant flow.

• Managed the recruitment process for statewide vacancies. • Developed recruitment bulletins, reviewed applications for minimum qualifications, notified applicants of final status, and responded to recruitment questions. • Conducted new employee orientation. Processed payroll time and attendance. • Trained and supervised HR front desk clerk.
• Temporary international Human Resources internship with a focus on recruitment.

external.en_us: Under general direction of the Manager of Treasury, this position is responsible for daily cash reconciliation and working cooperatively with multiple banking relationships and internal departments across subsidiaries to ensure security, timeliness, and accuracy in transfer of funds.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/ACCOUNTABLE FOR:

  • Analyzes and reviews all operational cash flows for the organization and prepares daily cash reports and trend analysis.
  • Leads engagement with multiple banking relationship teams and internal departments and users regarding transfer of funds, user access, and ad hoc user requests in accordance with internal controls.
  • Establishes required bank accounts, adds and/or removes user access, and drives the daily administration of bank accounts, investments, and/or debt obligations to ensure required funding and/or disbursement.
  • Processes cash requests from Chugach subsidiaries and off-site locations.
  • Prepares deposits for remote capture and for manual deposit.
  • Obtains general ledger account coding and supporting documentation for cash related transactions and prepares daily general journal entries, monthly investment journal entries and reconciles investment general ledger accounts.
  • Implements internal and industry-best fraud prevention practices, including the use of positive pay and suspicious checks activity.
  • Records profit distributions to and from partners including the preparation of distribution requests for approval
  • Assists with the setup of accounts, users, and reporting within the treasury platform, Kyriba.
  • Sets up bank accounts in the accounting system, Lawson.
  • Monitors rates and analyzes the impact of changes on the deposit accounts.
  • Identifies proper approval for transactions, initiates domestic and international electronic funds transactions for settlement of obligations.
  • Develops and maintains required records and maintains proper internal controls of recorded transactions.
  • Documents treasury procedures and maintains appropriate detail in coordination with treasury responsibilities and initiatives.
  • Maintains internal auditing practices and recommends more efficient methods of controls.
  • Assists department on projects for implementing systems and/or process changes to support increased efficiencies or conformance with internal controls.
  • Supports all aspects of Treasury Operations activities, including assisting with the development of cash management banking solutions for all business segments and supporting the consolidated cash forecasting process.
  • Provides backup to other CAC Accounting and Finance positions during scheduled and unscheduled absences.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned.

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS (Education, Experience, Professional Associations):

Mandatory

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or four (4) years of equivalent experience, or a combination of education and progressively responsible accounting experience.  
  • Demonstrated knowledge of general accounting practices including journal entries, reconciliations, and good internal control practices.
  • Demonstrated intermediate skills in the use of Excel, Word, and Outlook.

Preferred Software Experience

Lawson, Kyriba, Sage Intacct, SharePoint, Microsoft PowerBI, Adobe and Microsoft Office.

Knowledge Of: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP); commonly used accounting concepts, practices, and procedures; accounting software applications; operation of common office machinery including copiers, fax machines, and computers.

Ability To: Self motivate as well as work as a team player to meet deadlines and handle stressful situations; use interpersonal skills to effectively organize and communicate across business segments and external banking relationships; think analytically, problem solve and handle/safeguard confidential data and transactions; produce high quality work that is complete, accurate, timely.

work_experience.description: • Key Person in managing $1 Billion Fixed Income Portfolio (i.e. Loan & HELOC Participations) • Assists Treasury SVP with $500 Million portfolio allocated primarily in Repos, Municipal Bonds, Treasuries, and Mortgage-Backed Securities, etc. • Supervises the administration of the credit union's asset/liability m odel (ALM), liquidity forecast, cash management analytics and interest rate risk modeling and communicates the results and recommendations to the CRO and CFO. • Closely collaborates with Treasury, Accounting, IT and Audit to create innovative data visualizations presentations customized for senior executives and Board of Directors. • Actively supports Accounting with monthly close and in resolving issues in amortization, capitalization, accruals and cost allocation. Reviews the distribution of capital project expenditures and allocation of costs to individual projects within the approved budget. • Developed an investment optimization model that drives the credit union's overall portfolio allocation based on quantified risk attribution and portfolio variance in diverse rate forecasts. Added a model interface that runs real-time buy and sell scenarios to utilize in presentations to the Board of Directors.

• Established training modules to reduce skill gaps for established FP&A analysts and non- finance career transitioning clients. • Provided 20+ e-learning tutorials and customized content as part of study programs in professional certifications. • Crafted a Financial Readiness program aimed at high school seniors and implemented within FBISD.

Provided comprehensive financial planning for individual and small business clients that centered on 2 aspects of wealth management - growth and protection. • Constructed investment portfolios that utilized advanced statistical modeling to manage volatility and shortfall risk. • Conducted stress tests, simulations and variance analysis across different macroeconomic environments and market regimes. • Implemented investment strategies using quantitative and qualitative analysi s, along with a systematic screening process. • Rebalanced portfolios as appropriate to accomplish client objectives and mandates. • Achieved wealth protection through hedging techniques (i.e. insurance policies) and addressing client estate and tax planning needs. • Established a relationship-based client practice of 100 + and managed $2.5 million in assets within 2 years. • Took leadership initiative & mentored new financial advisor hires within my first year • Substantial sales and marketing experience. Conducted frequent presentations to diverse groups, including senior level management executives from several Fortune 500 companies.

external.en_us:
Expeditor provides labor and support of duties pertaining to the operation and maintenance of the rig.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Purchase and deliver requisitioned parts, supplies and equipment for the operation and maintenance of the drilling rig.
  • Ensure parts, supplies and equipment are delivered to drilling rig in timely manner.
  • Keep track of inventories
  • Record all purchases on a log and keep receipts, invoices and documentation related to any purchase

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 3 years in the drilling industry and previous expeditor experience required.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs.
  • Must possess clean driving record and provide copy.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.

 

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

external.en_us: Under the Apprenticeship Program, the Cultural Coordinator (Apprentice) reports directly to the Vice President of Cultural Resources providing administrative support to Cultural Resources Department. In this two-year on-the-job training position, the Apprentice assists in other special projects related to ANCSA Lands, preserving, and perpetuating our language and culture for the future, as directed.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & JOB FUNCTIONS / ACCOUNTABLE FOR:

  • Provides administrative and technical project support for the Cultural Resources department.
  • Assists in preservation of historical sites, other culturally significant lands, artifacts, Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act (NAGPRA) claims, long-term planning for land use and protection of cultural language, traditions, and cultural assets.
  • Compiles and maintains file systems such as financials, historical records, NAGPRA records, and translations.
  • Supports photo archive for the Cultural Resources department.
  • Utilizes planning tools to prepare Cultural Resources and Nuchek Facilities budgets for department review.
  • Assists with the design, purchase, and disbursement of promotional items.
  • Sets-up, orders, and processes vendor purchases, as well as check requests, as assigned.
  • Picks up and delivers supplies as needed.
  • Assists with new hire paperwork and processing timesheets for seasonal Nuchek camp facilities workers.
  • Provides administrative support to include communication with caretakers, camp preparation, documentation of processes and procedures, and with the annual inventory process.
  • Arranges travel, lodging and prepares expense reports for Cultural Resources department, as needed.
  • Communicates to outside organizations regarding efforts of cultural preservation within the Chugach region.
  • Attends events or meetings with federal agencies and regional organizations and reports back on topics discussed, action items and recommendations.
  • Drafts quarterly reports for the Vice President of Cultural Resources to review and present to the Board of Directors.
  • Coordinates departmental and Cultural Resources Goal, Action, Measure, Evaluate (G.A.M.E.) Plan reviews and revisions.
  • Participates in interdepartmental projects or other group projects for the cultural department as directed.
  • Assists in the development of an inventory control process to include conversion of historical document to electronic format and the management of cultural assets.
  • Prepares and provides accurate historical and cultural information to shareholders, internal and external audiences verbally or in presentation format.
  • Researches, completes data entry, and compiles information as assigned.
  • Performs other related work as assigned.

JOB REQUIREMENTS (Education, Experience, Professional Associations):

MANDATORY

  • Chugach Alaska Corporation shareholder or descendant of a shareholder.
  • Associates Degree in business, anthropology, linguistics, or relevant field
    • Relevant experience may be substituted, in lieu of degree, for each year of required education.
  • Valid state driver’s license with an acceptable driving record.
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite at an intermediate level, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

Knowledge Of: general administrative duties, common practices, and associated equipment; Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act (ANCSA) and Alaska State Statutes (Title 13); land ownership, culture/customs of the Alaska Natives of the Chugach Region; general budgeting principles and practices; land ownership, title and conveyance processes, and governmental permitting processes.

Ability To: maintain strict confidence; prioritize and complete projects in accordance with established deadlines; perform duties in a timely, cost effective manner; work independently; provide appropriate follow up; balance multiple tasks and deal with interruptions; communicate effectively orally and in writing with a broad audience; maintain good working relationships with all coworkers and the general public; use good judgement in recognizing scope of authority.

external.en_us:
Position Summary:
The Accounts Payable Analyst reports directly to the Program Manager and indirectly to an Alyeska Lead. The incumbent performs Accounts Payable transactions through working knowledge and understanding of procedures and AP processes. A successful candidate has experience with integrated financial systems such as Oracle and EBS Suite.

Chugach Alaska Services, LLC (CAS) is an Alaska Native-owned and operated staffing firm supporting Alaska's Oil & Gas Industry for over 28 years. CAS is recruiting for an Accounts Payable Analyst located in Anchorage, AK.

Expected Behaviors:

Chugach strives to employ individuals who believe the following behaviors are fundamental to any job: 

1. Always do the right thing 
2. Create meaningful value 
3. Leave things better than you found them 
4. Empower people 
5. Build community

Position Summary:

The Accounts Payable Analyst reports directly to the Program Manager and indirectly to an Alyeska Lead. The incumbent performs Accounts Payable transactions through working knowledge and understanding of procedures and AP processes. A successful candidate has experience with integrated financial systems such as Oracle and EBS Suite. 

Essential Duties & Job Functions:

  • Complies, organizes, processes and summarizes cost allocation and coding data directly related to department invoices
  • Reconciles invoices
  • Prepares documentation
  • Electronically submits invoices
  • Maintains records
  • Works closely with staff and clients to ensure consistency and compliance in established policies and procedures
  • Meet requests for information and issues resolution
  • Monitor vendor payments
  • Track credits owed and ensure all credits are properly applied to vendor payments
  • Reconcile payable reports each month to confirm all amounts paid are accurate
  • Process accounts payable transactions
  • Provide customer support to internal and external clients
  • Adheres to all Alyeska pipeline and Chugach Alaska Services policies, regulations, procedures, and code of conduct
  • Work cooperatively within a team setting and demonstrate attitude conductive to positive team morale

 Other Job Responsibilities:

  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements (Education, Experience, Training & Professional Certificates/Associations):

Mandatory

  • Highschool Diploma/GED
  • Two (2) years’ Accounts Payable experience
  • Working knowledge and an understanding of procedures and AP Processes
  • Skills Assessment with 40 WMP, excel, and word with 70% accuracy
  • Successfully pass a preemployment background check and drug screening

Preferred

  • Experience with integrated financial systems such as Oracle EBS Suite

Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Ability to work with a team
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of procedures and AP processes

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

name.en_us: Associates of Applied Science Process Technology

educations.description: The process technology program prepares students for employment as operations technicians in the process industry. This includes oil and gas production, mining and milling, transportation and refining, chemical manufacturing, power generation, utilities, wastewater treatment facilities maintenance and food processing.

description.pt_br: Inspirado a ter bom desempenho pela habilidade de contribuir para o sucesso de um projeto ou da organização

name.pt_br: Equilíbrio entre Trabalho e Vida Pessoal

description.en_us: Inspired to perform well by having ample time to pursue work and interests outside of work
description.de_de: Inspiriert durch ausreichend Zeit für die Arbeit und Interessen außerhalb der Arbeit
description.en_gb: Inspired to perform well by having ample time to pursue work and interests outside of work
description.es_es: Inspirado al buen desempeño por tener el tiempo suficiente para hacer su trabajo y atender a sus intereses fuera del trabajo
description.fr_ca: Tend à être performant(e) en disposant de tout le temps nécessaire pour faire son travail et s'adonner à ses centres d'intérêt après les heures de bureau
description.pt_br: Inspirado a ter bom desempenho ao desfrutar de tempo suficiente para o trabalho e para interesses pessoais
description.zh_cn: 提倡安排充足的时间从事工作以及工作以外的兴趣爱好，以此实现优异表现

description.en_us: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals
description.de_de: Inspiriert von der Möglichkeit, eigene Zeitpläne zu erstellen und selbst Ziele zu setzen
description.en_gb: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals
description.es_es: Inspirado al buen desempeño cuando se le concede la capacidad de fijar su propio horario y metas
description.fr_ca: Tend à être performant(e) lorsqu'on lui offre la possibilité de définir ses propres objectifs et échéances
description.pt_br: Inspirado a ter bom desempenho quando munido da possibilidade de definir seu cronograma e seus objetivos
description.zh_cn: 通过享有自主设定计划和目标的权利来实现优异表现

description.en_us: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks
description.de_de: Inspiriert von der anforderungsgerechten Erfüllung der Aufgaben
description.en_gb: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks
description.es_es: Inspirado al buen desempeño mediante la ejecución de tareas
description.fr_ca: L'atteinte des objectifs est ce qui le/la motive à être performant(e)
description.pt_br: Inspirado a ter bom desempenho para concluir tarefas
description.zh_cn: 通过完成任务实现优异表现

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

name.en_us: Associates of Applied Science Process Technology

educations.description: The process technology program prepares students for employment as operations technicians in the process industry. This includes oil and gas production, mining and milling, transportation and refining, chemical manufacturing, power generation, utilities, wastewater treatment facilities maintenance and food processing.

external.en_us:
Derrickhand provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for the uppermost section of the drilling string as it is brought from and lowered into the wellbore or drill hole.
  • Responsible for the oversight of some of the machinery on the Rig and for the conditioning of the drilling fluid and the circulation machinery.
  • Responsible for submitting orders to the Tool Pusher for all pump expendables and supplies pertaining to the mud pumps and mud systems.
  • Responsible for working with mud systems, monitoring weight and mixing weight properly while reporting any changes.
  • Must be able to work in a highly skilled team environment, effectively communicating with the Driller and other Rig members.
  • Spends 25% of time in the rig derricks and plays a lead role in stacking and guiding pipe as it is tripped in and out or reconnected into the hole.
  • Participates in Company Safety Program.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 3 years in the drilling industry as a Floorman or above.
  • Must possess current well control certification, 1st Aid, CPR and Forklift/Manlift certificates.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to use simple math to make job related calculations.
  • Knowledge of top drive design and function.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb derrick structures with required PPE, climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness for lengthy periods of time and lift 50 lbs.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

external.en_us: The CHF Administrative Assistant (Intern) will perform various clerical and administrative support to CHF as directed by the Program and Systems Manager in this on-the-job training position. The Intern will support scholarship and cultural programs to include outreach, marketing, and fund development.

Chugach’s Expected Behaviors

Chugach is looking for more people who believe that the following behaviors are fundamental to any job:

  1. Always doing the right thing
  2. Creating meaningful value
  3. Leaving things better than you found them
  4. Empowering people
  5. Building community

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & JOB FUNCTIONS / ACCOUNTABLE FOR:

  • Provides general administrative support for the Chugach Heritage Foundation.
  • Assists with CHF initiatives, programs, and projects.
  • Provides program feedback and completes written reports as directed.
  • Schedules meetings and maintains the Foundation’s annual calendar of events.
  • Assists with hosting cultural programs and events.
  • Assists with processing scholarship applications.
  • Assists with fund development initiatives.
  • Assists with producing and distributing external marketing material.
  • Maintains files, filing system, and records.
  • Assists with inventory and archiving.
  • Enters data and compiles information for review.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

JOB REQUIREMENTS (Education, Experience, Professional Associations):

  • Chugach Alaska Corporation (CAC) Shareholder or descendant of a CAC shareholder.
  • Currently enrolled in an accredited college as a full-time (12+ credits) student with a Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.0 or above (in each class).
  • Valid state Driver’s License with an acceptable driving record.
  • Demonstrated intermediate skills in the use of Excel, Word, and Outlook.

Knowledge Of: Alaska Native Culture, specifically within the Chugach Region; administrative procedures, policies, and practices; operation of common office machinery including copiers, fax machines, and computers.

Ability To: Strong organizational skills, accurate typing, and data entry skills, willing to learn file management systems, maintain confidentiality; communicate effectively orally and in writing; deal with people in a professional and courteous manner; exercise good judgement and initiative; be self-motivated and work with minimal supervision; interpret and analyze work-related problems and respond appropriately; work as a member of a team of individuals working toward a common goal.

external.en_us: Under the direction of the Director of Risk Management, the Risk Management Specialist provides day-to-day operations support. Performs various risk, legal and compliance activities as well as insurance management and claims. Maintains and provides access to Risk Department information. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented with strong written and verbal communications skills. The candidate will also be able to appropriately handle confidential and time sensitive information.

Essential Duties & Functions:

  • Assists with insurance renewals, including gathering and compiling exposure information, marketing preparation, proof of insurance documentation distribution, premium invoicing, billing allocation and auditing
  • Assists with day-to-day risk management activities, including claims review/filing and management, coordination of FMLA, worker compensation and return to work
  • Requests Certificates of Insurance and Bonds as needed
  • Supports monthly Risk Management Information System reconciliations
  • Supports monthly Workers Compensation and Auto billing review
  • Prepares reports and analysis of varying components of the risk program including but not limited to workers compensation trending reports, auto claims trending reports, deductible/SIR spend year over year, Total Cost of Risk
  • Addresses CCH operating entities requests for risk management support
  • Performs oversight of record keeping and tracking tasks associated with functions regarding entering of incident/accident reporting.
  • Assists with the creation and maintenance of Risk Management Department systems, to include record retention as well as policy and procedure process development
  • Review contract documents for consistency and adherence to templates and/or policies to include HSE provisions
  • Assists with the development of transactional documents and resolutions
  • Monitors outside counsel e-billing and matter management system for new and aging invoices; also provide reports from the system as requested
  • Organizes and maintains corporate books of CCH Corporate and all operating entities for internal and external audits
  • Coordinates internal litigation support, such as discovery documents, as needed
  • Addresses CCH operating entities requests for legal support
  • Performs other duties as assigned

Position Requirements (Education, Experience, Professional Associations):

Mandatory

    • Associate degree in risk management, business , legal, or related field or three (3) years of equivalent work experience in risk, safety or legal field
    • Certified Risk Manager (CRM) designation or willingness to work toward obtaining the CRM designation from the National Alliance for Insurance Education
    • Knowledge of risk management industry matters, claims management, ethics, and common practices
    • Demonstrated knowledge of Risk Management Information Systems software
    • Proficient in the use of MS Office Suite such as Excel, Word, and Outlook as well as database programs
    • Current valid state issued driver’s license with acceptable driving record
    • Ability to successfully pass any background check and/or drug test as required

    Demonstrated Personal Attributes to Include:

     

    • Ability to build trusted relationships
    • Excellent customer service skills
    • Organizational, technology, and project management skills
    • Effective communication skills, both oral and written
    • Strong collaboration skills
    • Exercises independent judgment
    • Handles confidential information appropriately

Floorhand provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for the assisting in the set up and take down of drilling rig equipment.
  • Responsible for handling, sorting and moving drill tools, pipe, cement, and other materials.
  • Carries out housekeeping tasks around the rig (washing, painting, digging, cleaning, etc.)
  • Performs daily maintenance on the rig floor equipment and pipe handling tools.
  • Responsible for the manipulation of the sections of pipe or drill stem at rig floor during drilling.
  • Responsible for removing and replacing the strings of pipe or drill stem and/or drill bit.
  • Responsible for maintaining an organized work environment on the rig.
  • Participates in Company Safety Program.


REQUIREMENTS:

  • HS diploma or GED
  • Preferably 2 years experience in the drilling industry.  Entry level will be considered.
  • Should possess current 1st Aid, CPR, and Forklift/Manlift certificates, or be willing to go through the training once employed.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions.
  • Possess hazard awareness necessary to operate safely within the drilling environment.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness and lift 50 lbs.
  • MUST pass urinary drug screening.

 

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.

external.en_us:
Summary/General Description Of Job:
The Accounting Specialist performs and provides support to major accounting areas including accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, general ledger, and account reconciliations. Reviews and interprets contracts to ensure accounting activities are performed in accordance with established requirements. The incumbent adheres to internal control processes and ensures that efficient and accurate accounting records are maintained.

Chugach Alaska Services, LLC (CAS) is an Alaska Native-owned and operated staffing firm supporting Alaska's Oil & Gas Industry for over 28 years. CAS is recruiting for a Accounting Specialist located in Anchorage, AK.

Essential Duties & Job Functions: 

  • Processes payroll, including gathering backup, completely preparing all timesheets, uploading into Lawson, and submitting for review. Reviews timesheets to ensure accuracy of coding and time entry. Reviews contract-based payroll edits. Processes payroll liability adjustments. 
  • Prepares A/P interfaces and EFTPS payment requests for payrolls. 
  • Prepares and enters journal entries relating to job costing. 
  • Reads and interprets contracts to ensure thorough understanding of billing and payroll requirements. Prepares billing invoices. Prepares reclasses for A/R and payroll. Maintains billing and contract files. Prepares A/R cash packet for payments received from customers. 
  • Sets up new contracts in accounting system.  Also completes set-up with cost coding for any change orders or delivery orders received.  Maintains cost code listing. 
  • Performs general ledger and bank reconciliations Prepares a variety of journal entries including investments, intercompany balances, cash, insurance, etc. Reviews trial balances and G&A costs. 
  • Prepares monthly union reports. 
  • Prepares labor/burden/fringe accruals for year-end and as needed for fixed price contracts. 
  • Reads and interprets collective bargaining agreements, as needed, to ensure compliance with contractual obligations and wage rates. 
  • Prepares required reports for management including unfunded/unbilled, job cost analysis, revenue reconciliation, job cost, etc. and completes required research and corrections to assure accuracy. 
  • Prepares reports for customers as required. 
  • Performs related work as assigned. 

 Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Professional Associations): 

Mandatory 

  • Associate degree in accounting with three (3) years of broad accounting experience. 
  • A high school diploma or equivalent and five (5) – seven (7) years of accounting experience may be substituted for associate degree. 
  • Intermediate or higher skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 

Personal Attributes of the Successful Candidate: 

  • Results oriented with strong accounting and math skills. 
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, and multi-tasking skills. 
  • Deadline oriented.  Works well under pressure 
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills. 
  • Self-motivated with strong organizational skills. Knowledge of commonly used accounting concepts, practices, and procedures. 
  • Demonstrated research and reporting skills. 
  • Excellent interpersonal skills. 
  • Ability to maintain strict confidentiality. 

 Preferred 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting. 
  • Prior Lawson experience. 
  • Experience in the oil and gas industry. 

Preference shall be given to eligible and qualified Chugach shareholders, spouses and descendants, and shareholders of other Alaska Native Corporations.  Chugach makes every effort to identify, hire, train, and promote shareholders.  Chugach is an equal opportunity employer.  The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information or any other factor protected by law.

work_experience.description: Led accounting activities, including monthly financial statement analysis, preparation, and presentation. Served as main point of contact for external parties (regulatory agencies, financial institutions, other stakeholders) and general counsel for financial-impacting claims or regulatory issues. Reported to controller. - Supervised general ledger, accounts payable / receivable, travel, and payroll functions, including 9 direct reports, mentoring and assisting with individual development plans to expand skills and promote advancement. - Prepared and reviewed monthly and quarterly financial statements, ensuring accurate statements and accompanying reports presented to owners on time each month. - Managed 2 external financial audits (APSC, Prince William Sound Oil Spill Response Corporation [PWSC]) and collaborated with Human Resources to manage external benefit audit, facilitating on-time audit completion without management comments. - Appointed treasurer for PWSC and audit subcommittee member for Alaska Clean Seas as APSC representative. - Prepared and presented annual budget and managed external accounting firm for company. - Ensured company met budget and able to declare dividend. - Partnered with controller in designing and implementing companywide internal controls. - Measured internal control effectiveness in collaboration with internal audit team. - Conducted quarterly internal control issue with controller, reporting findings and recommending solutions to uncovered issues. - Protected against fraud as treasury function main point of contact, including banking relations and accounts payable controls.

Led companywide initiative to create Fairbanks and Valdez facility to consolidate engineers in single location. - Developed plan, relocated impacted employees to Anchorage, and orchestrated facility restack to accommodate new employee influx, completing on time, safely, and with minimal business disruption.
Served as primary accountant for preparation, submission, and payment of APSC and PWSC corporate, property, fuel, and other miscellaneous taxes, fees, and licenses.

Oversaw accounting billing and facility activities. Partnered with Chief Medical Office on clinic operations. Reported to Chief Executive Officer (CEO). - Increased cash flow by improving business processes through initiatives that maximized patient appointments, expedited billing, and established collections process for overdue payments. - Teamed with CEO on feasibility analysis for combining 2 clinics into single 50K-square-foot clinic for efficiency and space optimization, gaining Board support to secure funding for new clinic.

Managed $80M annual budget, $9M investment portfolio, and $14M indirect cost pool. Collaborated with and reported to 42 tribes, executive board, and finance subcommittee. Reported to president / CEO. - Oversaw Oracle management and accounting system implementation, enabling access to needed financial documentation and insight to maintain program compliance. - Collaborated with 42 tribal leaders / Board of Directors to streamline administrative cost and reallocated those costs to operations, allowing TCC to achieve reasonable indirect rate to position for additional grant funding.

external.en_us:
Driller provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Operate drilling equipment as instructed in the well program in a manner that complies with Company policies and procedures.
  • Operate all equipment at the Driller's console in a safe manner; maintain a clean, tidy and hazard- free condition on the drill floor and associated area
  • Monitor the well condition at all times (i.e. depth, mud weight, weight on bit.)
  • Recognize, interpret and respond to down hole conditions
  • Perform drilling- related operations such as directional drilling, working stuck pipe, running and cementing casing strings, coring, fishing, and assisting in wireline logging, well testing, and other special operations.
  • Supervise and direct operations in the picking up or laying down of tubular and all drilling-related equipment
  • Maintain accurate record of tubular and tool dimensions (i.e. internal and external diameter, fish neck, and serial numbers)  Ensure that the solid control equipment and mud mixing operations are being monitored constantly
  • Inform Toolpusher/Senior Toolpusher and Client Representative if a deviation from planned operation occurs
  • Keep accurate records of fluid displacement when tubulars are run in/pulled out of well.
  • Complete the IADC daily drilling report (GMS) at the end of each tour
  • Hold pre-tour meeting with the drilling crew for all drilling operations.
  • Secure the well during an emergency or well control situation; assist in the well-killing operations.
  • Supervise the lubrication and maintenance of all drilling and associated equipment and ensure it is carried out in accordance with the Preventive Maintenance System (RMS).
  • Maintain equipment files, drilling logs and records; perform all technical calculations required to carry out drilling operations Assist during the running and retrieving of marine risers and BOP stack
  • Assist in the planning, organization and supervision of rig move operations

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 5 years in the drilling industry.
  • Must possess current  well control certification, 1st Aid, CPR and Forklift/Manlift certificates.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to use simple math to make job related calculations.
  • Knowledge of top drive design and function.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb derrick structures with required PPE, climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness for lengthy periods of time and lift 50 lbs.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.

 

HSE and CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

external.en_us:
Roustabout provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Safely and efficiently perform the general manual labor tasks throughout the rig under the supervision of the Toolpusher.
  • Offloading and backloading of supply vessels, maintenance, clean up, housekeeping, chipping and painting of the rig, the movement and relocation of supplies, groceries and equipment of the rig, simple maintenance and repairs to the plumbing and sewer systems, working in the chemical mixing area, as well as providing relief workers for the drill floor crew and assistance to the Welder, Mechanic, Electrician, Driller or Derrickhand as directed to do so by the Crane Operator.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 1 year in the drilling industry as a Roustabout or above.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to climb derrick structures with required PPE, climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness for lengthy periods of time and lift 50 lbs.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.
