external.en_us: The Technical Writer will compile, edit, and proofread technical data for use in routine documents or sections of documents and other publications following established procedures and formats.

Chugach Alaska Services, LLC (CAS) is an Alaska Native-owned and operated staffing firm supporting Alaska's Oil & Gas Industry for over 28 years. CAS is recruiting for a Technical Writer located in Anchorage, AK.

Expected Behaviors:

Chugach strives to employ individuals who believe the following behaviors are fundamental to any job: 

1. Always do the right thing 
2. Create meaningful value 
3. Leave things better than you found them 
4. Empower people 
5. Build community

Position Summary:

The Technical Writer will compile, edit, and proofread technical data for use in routine documents or sections of documents and other publications following established procedures and formats.

Essential Duties & Job Functions:

  • Work with the ERMS manager, Enterprise Risk Management Coordinator and the implementing AMS document owners to review and implement changes to assure documents are in alignment with the Grant and Lease.
  • Update the QA-36, Quality Assurance Program Manual and accompanying document REF- 00059 - QA-36, Quality Assurance Program Implementing Documents Matrix.
  • Work with the ERMS Manager and the Enterprise Risk Management Coordinator to write the monthly TFX one-page communications documents.
  • The individual will ensure their work is consistent and compliant with Alyeska’s standards. They will adhere to the Alyeska Style Manual, acronym and key terms list.

    Other Job Responsibilities:
  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements (Education, Experience, Training & Professional Certificates/Associations):

Mandatory

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Three (3) years of direct or related exempt level experience in technical writing or effective written communication and quality assurance.
  • Proficient with utilizing other Microsoft Office suite software such as Word and PowerPoint.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and perform successfully in a team environment.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality on sensitive information.
  • Successfully pass a pre-employment background check, medical and drug screening.

Preferred

  • Seven (7) years of direct or related exempt level experience in technical writing or effective written communication.

Physical Demand/Work Environment:

The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by the incumbent to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to type, talk and hear. The incumbent is frequently required to sit, stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel or crouch. The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Visual acuity: must be adequate to perform all required tasks in a safe manner.

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate but may be loud on occasion. Work is usually performed in an office setting and sometimes at a client facility or job site. Work may require occasional weekend and/or evening work. The incumbent is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts, vehicles, and equipment.

The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by the incumbent to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to type, talk and hear. Visual acuity: must be adequate to perform all required tasks in a safe manner.

Disclaimer: The above job description covers the principal duties and responsibilities of the job. The description shall not, however, be construed as a complete job listing of all duties, which may be required from day-to-day.

Preference shall be given to eligible and qualified Chugach shareholders spouses and descendants, and shareholder of other Alaska Native Corporations. Chugach makes every effort to identify, hire, train, and promote shareholders. Chugach is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information or any other factor protected by law.

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

name.en_us: Associates of Applied Science Process Technology

educations.description: The process technology program prepares students for employment as operations technicians in the process industry. This includes oil and gas production, mining and milling, transportation and refining, chemical manufacturing, power generation, utilities, wastewater treatment facilities maintenance and food processing.

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

name.en_us: Associates of Applied Science Process Technology

educations.description: The process technology program prepares students for employment as operations technicians in the process industry. This includes oil and gas production, mining and milling, transportation and refining, chemical manufacturing, power generation, utilities, wastewater treatment facilities maintenance and food processing.

question.en_us: Do you have a high school diploma or equivalent?

value.en_us: Shareholder of another Alaska Native Corporation (ANC)

question.en_us: I am a

By typing in my name in the text box below, I acknowledge the following statement: Any ideas, invention or improvement made or conceived by me during any employment resulting from this application to Chugach Alaska Corporation (CAC), including its subsidiaries (all hereafter referred to as Company) relating to the Company activities, or work I perform for the Company, shall be the sole property of the Company and I will execute all papers necessary to vest title thereto in the Company or its nominee(s) in the United States and foreign countries.
The information that is provided in this application for employment is true, correct and complete. If employed, any misstatement or omission of fact on this application may result in my dismissal. I authorize investigation of all statements contained in this application for employment as may be necessary in arriving at an employment decision. This authorization includes permission to check employment references.
I understand that acceptance of an offer of employment does not create a contractual obligation or permanent employment upon the Corporation. Employment may be terminated at any time at the option of the employee or the Corporation.
To comply with the Drug Free Workplace Act of 1988, some employees are required to participate in an education and awareness program. Employees working on specific U.S. Government contracts or contracts regulated by the U.S. Government are affected. It may be necessary for you to submit to drug testing."
Are you eligible for employment in the U.S.A.?
Rate of Pay Desired?
Are you 18 years or older?
Were you previously employed by Chugach Alaska Corporation or one of its subsidiaries?
Are you proficient with utilizing other Microsoft Office suite software such as Word and PowerPoint?
Do you have strong written and oral communication skills?
Do you have the ability to work independently and perform successfully in a team environment?
Do you have at least three (3) years of direct or related exempt level experience in technical writing or effective written communication and quality assurance?
When are you available to start?

external.en_us: The position provides field and office support for package development, package review, execution and closeout of System Integrity related work packers. This position requires field travel.

Chugach Alaska Services, LLC (CAS) is an Alaska Native-owned and operated staffing firm supporting Alaska's Oil & Gas Industry for over 28 years. CAS is recruiting for a Integrity Engineer/Tech located in Valdez, AK.

Expected Behaviors:

Chugach strives to employ individuals who believe the following behaviors are fundamental to any job: 

  1. Always do the right thing 
  2. Create meaningful value 
  3. Leave things better than you found them 
  4. Empower people 
  5. Build community

Position Summary:

The position provides support for package development, package review, execution and closeout of System Integrity related work packers. This position requires field travel.  Rotational travel from Anchorage, housing and per diem are reimburse-able for this position.

Essential Duties & Job Functions:

  • Oversee the field delivery of inspection services.
  • Support the planning, implementation, data management, and assurance of integrity activities.
  • Provide general support and expertise as requested.
  • Perform DOT OQ covered tasks required for pipeline inspections.
  • Support execution with a rotational schedule during the implementation season as needed
  • Adheres to Alyeska’s Pipeline and Chugach Alaska Services policies, procedures, regulations, and code of conduct.

Other Job Responsibilities:

  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements (Education, Experience, Training & Professional Certificates/Associations):

Mandatory

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent experience
  • Minimum of two years’ experience with project engineering and management including design engineering preparation and oversight, field implementation support, development of construction drawings, and project closeout
  • Ability to coordinate and interact successfully with Discipline Engineering, Systems Integrity, Maintenance, and Third-Party support contractors
  • Ability to work independently and perform successfully in team environment
  • Ability to travel up to 50% and work weekends or varied shifts as required to support implementation
  • Strong written and oral communication skills with demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with team members and internal and external stakeholders
  • Ability to enter confined spaces to support work duties
  • A valid Driver’s License is required to support visits to field locations
  • Successfully pass a pre-employment DOT background check, medical and drug screening, and fit test.

Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Ability to work independently and perform successfully in a team environment.
  • Ability to coordinate and interact successfully with Engineering, System Integrity, Maintenance, and supporting third party contractors.
  • Advanced communication skills, both written and orally.
  • Strong attention to detail.

Preferred

  • Experience with engineering package preparation, cost controls, schedule, and change management
  • Development, technical review, and regulatory support for Integrity Management Plans, operations procedures, and functional check-out procedures
  • Familiar with API and NACE Recommended Practices and ASME Piping Codes (e.g., API 579, API 580, ASME B31.4/B31.8/B31.3)
  • Experience in pipeline threat identification, risk assessments, integrity assessments, and preventive & mitigative measures
  • NACE and/or API certifications related to pipeline, facility piping, and storage tank inspections
  • Experience performing integrity examinations including:
    • Internal/external pipe corrosion evaluations,
    • Mechanical damage assessment,
    • Aboveground storage tanks,
    • Coatings assessment
    • NDT Methods for integrity direct examinations
  • Impressed current and galvanic cathodic protection system design
  • Installation support and commissioning of new cathodic protection systems
  • API 653 Tank Inspection Certification
  • Oversight of the inspection and repair/alteration of large hydrocarbon storage tanks
  • API 570 Process Piping Inspection Certification
  • Quality analysis and review of corrosion data including in-line inspection, non-destructive testing, cathodic protection, corrosion inhibitor and biocide injection, corrosion coupons and external visual inspection
  • Oversight of non-destructive testing inspection contractors

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

name.en_us: Associates of Applied Science Process Technology

educations.description: The process technology program prepares students for employment as operations technicians in the process industry. This includes oil and gas production, mining and milling, transportation and refining, chemical manufacturing, power generation, utilities, wastewater treatment facilities maintenance and food processing.

work_experience.description: • Continuous improvement of manager and employee performance by identifying and clarifying problems; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solution; coaching and counseling for employees. • Works in partnership with department directors and managers to launch recruitment strategy of job requisitions through career fairs, job analysis, creation of job descriptions, and job evaluation. • Screens qualified candidates and serves as an active member of the interview and selection committees to ensure interviews are conducted in a legal manner. • Directs HR/Payroll Technicians on cradle to grave employee transactions. • Counsel leaders on conflict resolution, compliance standards (state/federal), policy interpretation and progressive disciplinary procedures. • Performs new employee orientation and on-boarding, company benefits and compensation administration, HRIS analysis/auditing/reporting, and department training initiatives.

• Assists in the establishment and communication of employee and executive compensation plans, benefits programs, policies and procedures consistent with the values and strategic objectives for ASRC employees. • Researches, analyzes, and recommends compensation levels for requested positions and salary data. Administers a job evaluation process to determine pay grades for individual jobs that are consistent with the external market and internal guidelines. • Assists with formulation of job descriptions. • Assisted in descriptive reports with metrics to measure the rate of employee advancements/ !1 of !3 promotions within the Enterprise. • Emphasis on coordinating and communicating compensation programs: pay grades, pay ranges, and bonus plan inquiries for leaders in HR and other business groups. • Assisted with KPI development, calculation, interpretation, and reporting. Processed feedback files for 401K deferral election, qualit

• Responsible for performing daily operational check of facility. • Prepares, maintains, and submits daily reports of applicable production volumes, gas or oil volume, well pressure, and/or volume of chemicals used. • Ensure safe working conditions and compliance with all safety and environmental practices and procedures. • Develop and execute energy isolation plans for maintenance activities. • Use of verification application to verify critical work and log failures. • Troubleshooting of operational and maintenance problems.

• Assisted in operations department project planning, schedule analysis, reporting and identified resources for project succession. • Partnered with inter company departments and north slope management/key project personnel for project succession. • Assisted in the roll out of strategic communication initiatives with business managers. • POC for day to day staff operations. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.

• Provides high level administrative support to executives; performs a variety of complex and diversified clerical and administrative duties of a sensitive and confidential nature. • Makes decisions about priority correspondence between departments. • Coordinates special events, travel arrangements and communication. • Develops respective materials for board meetings, reconciles reports and collects data for business analysis. • Established a strong internal and external network building on the corporate value of fostering positive relations and corporate branding.
Systems & Software: • ATS/HRMS/HRIS Applications: ADP, Oracle, Great Plains, iCIMS • Benefits Applications: Laserbeam, TIPS, Plansource, Charles Schwab, Fidelity • Office Applications: Adobe + Advanced Microsoft Suite

name.en_us: Pepperdine University, Graduate School of Education & Psychology

educations.description: A strong clinical emphasis, courses are focused on how the art and science of psychology can be applied to further our understanding of human behavior, industrial organization, and the prevention / diagnosis, and treatment of mental and emotional disorders.
Includes key elements of human resources, finance, project management, accounting, and marketing.

Sociology is the study of society, ranging from interactions in small groups to large-scale forces transforming entire civilizations. Our department is committed to training students in both sociological theory and applied empirical research so that they may become practitioners and participants in building a better world. Alaska is an ideal setting for the study of sociology due to the diversity of its people, its dynamic social landscape, and its distinct urban and rural ways of life.

name.en_us: Associates of Applied Science Process Technology

educations.description: The process technology program prepares students for employment as operations technicians in the process industry. This includes oil and gas production, mining and milling, transportation and refining, chemical manufacturing, power generation, utilities, wastewater treatment facilities maintenance and food processing.

external.en_us:
Motorman provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • The Motorman will ensure regular preventative maintenance activities for the main engines, generators, air compressors, portable water system, sewage treatment system, drill water manifold and pumps, bilge system, fire pumps and cold start air compressors.
  • Preventative maintenance will occur in a timely manner so as to prevent downtime and ensure the efficient and continual function of the mechanical equipment on board the drilling rig.
  • The motorman works as an assistant to the Mechanic, if one is aboard, for major mechanical problems and repairs.
  • Motorman is responsible for performing deck load inspections and calculating deck loads

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 3 years in the drilling industry as a Floorman or above.
  • Must possess current 1st Aid, CPR and Forklift/Manlift certificates.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to use simple math to make job related calculations.
  • Knowledge of top drive design and function.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb derrick structures with required PPE, climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness for lengthy periods of time and lift 50 lbs.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.

 

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

Perform various welding processes on drilling rigs and associated equipment
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • To perform various welding processes on drilling rigs and associated equipment. Under direct supervision, has responsibility for joining piping and other metal components, makes metal parts used in drilling, and weld parts, tools, machines and equipment. Read blueprints, layouts and work orders.
  • Must be able to weld to specific tolerances.
  • Must maintain welding equipment e.g. tips, wires etc.
  • Must be able to produce required quantities of products of varying sizes and complexity.
  • Must be able to fabricate products.
  • Maintain clean and safe environment.
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
  • To liaise with the Rig Manager, Driller, Electrician and Mechanic to schedule major overhauls of rig equipment


REQUIREMENTS:

  • HS diploma or GED
  • Welding certification (s) – depending on the type of welding job
  • Preferably 5+ years welding experience in the drilling industry.  Entry level will be considered.
  • Should possess current 1st Aid, CPR, or be willing to go through the training once employed.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions.
  • Possess hazard awareness necessary to operate safely within the drilling environment.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness and lift 50 lbs.
  • MUST pass urinary drug screening.

 

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

external.en_us:
Toolpusher provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for own personal safety and the safety of co-workers
  • Assist OIM in all operations carried out on the rig
  • Provide Drillers and crewmembers help and guidance as needed
  • Ensure activities are conducted in compliance with permits and drilling program
  • Assist Drillers in delegating work for crewmembers and follow through
  • Ensure rig and equipment is maintained properly
  • Assist Operator Representative in any matter they have concerning the rig or well
  • Maintain good working relations with other departments
  • Participate in on-the-job training and formal training of crews
  • Assist in making sure all paperwork is done correctly and in a timely fashion
  • Keep a good attitude about job and surroundings

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School graduate or GED
  • Requires a minimum of 5 years as toolpusher in the industry industry.
  • Must possess current well control certification, 1st Aid, CPR and Forklift/Manlift certificates.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions as well as give them.
  • Ability to use simple math to make job related calculations.
  • Knowledge of top drive design and function.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb derrick structures with required PPE, climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness for lengthy periods of time and lift 50 lbs.
  • Must pass pre-employment UA.

 

HSE and CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

work_experience.description: • Provide strategic HR leadership and consultation to officers and line managers. • Oversee recruitment and retention program for the Salvation Army. • Manage employee benefits and retirement programs. • Supervise HR department staff. • Manage performance evaluation process. • Develop and update personnel policies.

• Conducted and managed investigations regarding employee complaints, grievances, and other employee relations matters. • Consulted with legal counsel on personnel related matters when appropriate. • Advised management regarding employee relations matters dealing with corrective action, discipline, leave of absence and safety. • Served as Acting HR Director in the absence of the HR Director, to include supervision of HR staff. • Drafted personnel policies and other HR procedures. • Prepared and writes reports utilizing Business Intelligence in Ulti Pro for a variety of purposes according to business needs. • Oversaw exit interviews and termination notifications, and assisted managers with questions on terminating employees. • Assisted in workforce reduction planning. Communicated to employees regarding layoffs. • Facilitated return-to-work process and answers employee's questions on return-to-work. • Performed full-cycle recruitment for senior level positions.

• Developed and implemented specialized multidisciplinary recruiting, advertising and marketing strategies for sourcing and referring qualified applicants for all vacancies. • Reviewed and analyzed requests for recruitment assistance; identified needs of the facility regarding the vacancy and requirements of the position. Identified and utilized advertising sources. • Contacted and screened applicants; provided vacancy and organizational information to applicants. Documented applicants in recruitment database system; referred qualified applicants to hiring managers. Guided potential applicants through the recruitment and referral process. • Marketed and promoted ANTHC and its regional sites at job fairs and national conferences. Networked, collaborated and promoted organization with other institutions, universities, and professional organizations. • Reviewed and tracked vacancies. Identified and tracked recruitment strategies, successes, initiatives and trends.

• Managed the hiring process for exempt and non-exempt employees throughout the state of Alaska. • Selected, trained, and supervised In-Store Recruiters at each store location. • Interviewed and selected new hires for retail store positions. • Developed and coordinated hiring action plans for remodels and new store openings. • Established and maintained relationships with employment referral sources. • Represented Carrs/Safeway at job fairs and community events. • Partnered with community based organizations to increase applicant flow.

• Managed the recruitment process for statewide vacancies. • Developed recruitment bulletins, reviewed applications for minimum qualifications, notified applicants of final status, and responded to recruitment questions. • Conducted new employee orientation. Processed payroll time and attendance. • Trained and supervised HR front desk clerk.
• Temporary international Human Resources internship with a focus on recruitment.

external.en_us:
Mechanic provides manual labor and support of duties pertaining to the rig floor.
This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work. When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • To ensure that all operation of electrical rig components is carried out in a safe manner and in accordance with the manufacturers' specifications
  • To carry out unscheduled repairs at the rig site and camp
  • To liaise with the Rig Manager, Driller and Mechanic to schedule major overhauls of rig equipment
  • To ensure the availability of adequate spare parts for electrical equipment through the inventory system, both for routine maintenance and to cover unscheduled maintenance or replacements


REQUIREMENTS:

  • HS diploma or GED
  • Journeyman card
  • Preferably 5+ years electrician experience in the drilling industry.  Entry level will be considered.
  • Should possess current 1st Aid, CPR, or be willing to go through the training once employed.
  • Ability to read, write and speak English to be able to understand verbal and written instructions.
  • Possess hazard awareness necessary to operate safely within the drilling environment.
  • Able to work in high places for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to climb tall flights of stairs, work out of a riding harness and lift 50 lbs.
  • MUST pass urinary drug screening.

 

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Commitment to Excellence – Identifies what needs to be done and takes action to achieve a standard of excellence beyond job expectations.
  • Corporate Values- Understand, embraces, and integrates corporate values into everyday duties and responsibilities.
  • Customer Service – Identifies and responds to current and future client needs by providing excellent service to internal and external clients.
  • Safety and Security – Promotes a safe work environment for co-workers and customers.
  • Teamwork – Resourceful team player that builds, strengthens, and maintains collaborative relationships with others inside or outside the organization.

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Adaptability- Adapts to changing conditions and work assignments, sets priorities and manages multiple assignments, and tasks.
  • Attention to Detail- Ensures one's own and other's work and information are complete and accurate.
  • Communication Skills- Listens, writes, and speaks effectively, and positively relates and interacts with co-workers, customers and others.
  • Dependability- Consistently adheres to operational standards, ensures smooth operations and positive customer experiences, builds a productive workplace, is reliable, and improves team morale
  • Self-motivated- Requires little to no supervision, works well both independently and as part of a team.

 

This position is an open continuous vacancy due to the seasonal nature of our work.   When an opening occurs, applications will be reviewed at that time, and candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted directly
